doc:
Helen Ware https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Helen_Ware 0 Helen Ware (born Helen Remer, October 15, 1877 – January 25, 1939) was an American stage and film actress. Born to John August Remer and Elinor Maria (née Ware), Ware adopted her mother's maiden name as her professional name. She had three siblings, Ada, Richard, and John Remer. Before becoming an actress she worked as a governess. She had a successful Broadway stage career making her first appearance in 1899 with Maude Adams and by her thirties was playing the character parts for which she became famous. She began playing character parts in silent films in 1914 and continued into the sound era. Like Louise Closser Hale, Ware was a raven haired woman for most of her stage career, but adopted an all blond coif towards the late 1920s at the end of the silent era and into the talkies. Helen_Ware ( born Helen_Remer , October_15_,_1877 – January_25_,_1939 ) was an_American_stage_and_film_actress . Born to John_August_Remer and Elinor_Maria_( née_Ware_) , Ware adopted her_mother 's_maiden_name as her_professional_name . She had three_siblings , Ada , Richard , and John_Remer . Before becoming an_actress she worked as a_governess . She had a_successful_Broadway_stage_career making her_first_appearance in 1899 with Maude_Adams and by her_thirties was_playing the_character_parts for which she became famous . She began_playing character_parts in silent_films in 1914 and continued into the_sound_era . Like Louise_Closser_Hale , Ware was a_raven haired woman for most of her_stage_career , but adopted an all_blond_coif towards the_late_1920s at the_end of the_silent_era and into the_talkies .
